items: Start by hanging from a pull-up bar with your arms fully extended and your hands shoulder-width apart.
Engage your core and lift your legs up towards the bar, bending at the hips and bringing your knees towards your chest.
Continue to lift your legs up and over the bar, allowing your body to rotate as you do so.
As you come around to the other side of the bar, straighten your arms and lower your body down towards the ground.
Once your body is fully extended, reverse the movement and bring your legs back up towards the bar, bending at the hips once again.
Continue to repeat the movement, rotating your body around the bar and lowering yourself down towards the ground with each repetition.
Strengthens the upper body, particularly the shoulders, back, and core muscles
Improves flexibility and mobility in the shoulders and spine
Can help with injury prevention and rehabilitation
Challenges the mind and body, promoting mental toughness and resilience
